conclusion: The problem involves four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on a green surface, with a light source moving to the back right.
The task is to determine how the shadows change in position and size when the light source moves to the back right.
The toilet paper roll has a red cross on it and is positioned on the left side.
The plate has a red, strawberry-like top and is positioned to the right of the toilet paper roll.
The tall, thin object looks like a stick or rod and is positioned further to the right.
The circular ring is below and to the right of the plate.

In the first image, the shadows are positioned based on the initial light source: shadow C points upwards to the right, shadow B points upwards to the right, shadow D points upwards to the right, and shadow A points upwards to the right.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will move in the opposite direction, towards the front left.
The shadow of the toilet paper roll (C) should move more towards the left and possibly downward.
The shadow of the plate (B) should also move towards the front left.
